verb.description: Introduce semen into (a woman or a female animal) by natural or artificial means.
examples: the mares are inseminated when they are at their most receptive
the widow was inseminated using the frozen sperm of her husband

origin: Early 17th century: from Latin inseminat- sown, from the verb inseminare, from in- into + seminare plant, sow (from semen, semin- seed, semen).
